title: return to older version
content:
I have Thunderbird in 3 computers. I downloaded the upgrade this week and a lot of changes took place. Then I got locked out? All kinds of colors turned themselves on, then it kept asking me if I wanted to change a function???? I kept saying no, then yes. It continued to ask. Turned off the computer and worried if I get my old stuff back. Today it is working but incoming mail is in the lower part of the screen, old mail is in the top. How do I go back to the old version. This is my desktop

I just turned on my laptop and it asked me to upgrade. NOPE! I've used you guys for years and only made a small donation, sorry. Didn't know you have an app for my Android??? Would have tried it. Does your browser follow and track me like Chrome, which I hate. I will aways speak well of you guys even if I can't go back to the older version. See ya, Randy

title: Thunderbird Freezing and Missing Sent Emails
content:
Dear Support Team,

For the past two weeks, I have been experiencing significant issues with Thunderbird. The program frequently freezes, and I have also noticed that some of my sent emails are missing from the "Sent" folder.

I would like to mention that other colleagues using the same email accounts do not encounter these problems, and Thunderbird has worked smoothly for me over the last 5 years. The issues started after I returned from a 2.5-week vacation during which I did not open the program.

Could you please help me resolve these issues? Any advice or troubleshooting steps would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards, Rafał

title: RFE: How to choose proper return-path (using user login)
content:
Hi,

New policy (in France) only allows SMTP server to accept mail from addresses of the same domain that the user.

Ex: smtp.orange.fr only accepts mail from *@orange.fr Ex: mail.gandi.net, when user is foo@domain.tld, only accepts mail from foo@domain.tld

Issue: it is not possible to use email aliases anymore (ex for project email, such as *@php.net, *@fedoraproject)

Proposal:

Allow to use user login in mail envelop (in "MAIL FROM:" for SMTP protocol, so as return-path) instead of profile email (which can be an unallowed alias)

Tested from CLI, it seems to work.
creator: remi21

title: K-9 (TBird for Android) Calendar sync support - when ?
content:
Hello TBird fans,

I wonder when ThunderBird native client for Android (currently named "K-9") will evolve to a point when internal calendar syncing will work properly, eliminating the need to import google calendars into desktop Tbird ? Is it possible to estimate that time now, or it's better to search for alternative solution(s) ?

I will need an Android synced calendar app soon, I would prefer ThunderBird, since I've been using it for at least a decade, and I'm not even satisfied but became enthusiast also. Best email client ever made IMHO. It would be very convenient to use TBird's integrated calendar.

I've searched the forums for "android calendar sync", but didn't find corresponding info, just this archived thread is closest to my question (particularly the 3. question of it) : https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1436077

I'm not willing to use google calendar, since I don't want unstoppable notifications and ads when my events are due in time.

Thanks, Peter ;-)

title: Reminders Windows (Popup Window)
content: Hi, I've tried searching for this but there seems to be alot of misunderstanding as to what is being asked, so please forgive the length of this post. Running Windows 7, Thunderbird 115.15.0 (64-bit). On opening Thunderbird or when a reminder point for a calendar or event is due a Reminders Window Pops Up showing all reminders/events. I can dismiss individulally or All or snooze indivulally or All. There is also an option [X] to close the window. Q, As to my actual question, if that window is closed, for what ever reason, I can not find away of re-opening the window, any help on how to do this? Please note I am not referring to the "Today Pain" which I can show or hide as needed. As an example I may have an appointment due on the 12th of the month, but need to prepare for it so I set a reminder for 3 days before, ie 9th. So on the 9th a reminder for the appointment appears allowing me to dismiss or snooze. I would commonly start to prepare and as such leave the reminder as is, not clicking dismiss or snooze but closing the window. Later on in the day I wish to open the window so I can clear the reminder. That's the window I wish to open and do not know how. Snoozing will not help as I may not be able to predict how long it takes me to prepare and therefore can snoze for too long or too short. I've included a screen shot of the actual window in question with a dummy reminder. Hope this was too long and thanks for any help offered.
creator: Private61

title: How to make email folder structure on new device visible to filter rules there ?
content:
Message filters not working after transfer to new windows device. (Apologies for long report below). Problem is similar to that reported and still unsolved here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1391209

All old messages automatically accessed under IMAP protocol sit within correct email folder on new device.

Message filters rules successfully located on old device, copied and placed in corresponding windows folder on new device. Email folder structure looks identical on both devices.

New messages sit in inbox on new device, without being filtered. Instead error messages appear, repeatedly.

"The folder 'xxxx' could not be found, so filter(s) associated with this folder will be disabled. Verify that the folder exists, and that filters point to a valid destination folder.

The folder 'yyyy' could not be found, so filter(s) associated with this folder will be disabled. Verify that the folder exists, and that filters point to a valid destination folder.

If same new messages are accessed on old device, they later appear in correct folder on new device, and no longer sit in inbox

How to make email folder structure on new device visible to filter rules there ? This is necessary for filtered email to work successfully on new device, without requiring old device to be operational - it will be taken out of service in near future.
creator: robert.heyward

title: Unable to write the email to the mailbox solved I think
content:
I use thunderbird for 3 pop accounts and was starting to get this message on one of them: "Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough space....."

Not sure which thing solved it, but I

Tried thunderbird in windows safe mode with networking and new emails were downloaded properly with no error message.

Then I restarting in normal windows mode and tried Thunderbird again. I got no warning but maybe there was no new emails on that account.

Thunderbird asked to compress the files and I said yes.

Then I tested all send and receive and all good with no warning.
